title: Another Obama Gun Control Myth Debunked

content: As much of a backer of the 2nd Amendment as I am, I really can't see why such guns as a MAC-10 should even be manufactured. The military doesn't want them. They don't work very well as self-protection weapons - So who wants or needs them? What is their real purpose? I was at a gunshow yesterday, and frankly, many of the weapons I saw for sale made me shake my head: M-2 .50 Cal Machine guns! Yes, if you have the right permit, you can buy a fully functional one. About four different varieties of .50 Cal Sniper Rifles - great for hunting rabbits and coyotes I guess. And no permit of any kind require for those babies - guaranteed to shoot 5 inch groups at 2000 yards! Super - or stupid - - I was walking through this gigantic show, which covered an area larger than a football field, with my son who is a Policeman. We just shook our heads at all the weird guns people were snatching up, and the huge lines at the Ammo Concession, where people were panic-buying hundreds of pounds of bullets . .. What was even more scary was that I saw groups speaking spanish, russian, and several other languages buying up all kinds of guns - spooky... My feeling were definitely mixed. I'm a gun owner, but I didn't buy anything. Neither did my son - though we both looked at several handguns. As we left, I kinda wondered if any of those people would some day aim one of those at my boy - chilling. . . When I dropped him off at his house, my last words were, "Make sure you always wear your vest to work..." "I always do," he said..... Wandering and Wondering

And that could obviously lead to the very meltdown that should never happen - - Wandering and Wondering

content: I'm lost. Bush made a ruling that firearms were legal to carry on Federal Parks and reservations? Yes? The US government is the largest owner of property in the country so outlawing concealed weapons take into account a very large area of land. A judge rules inviromental laws need to be scruntinized and to retain a 26 year old law prohibiting guns. so Obama will not challenge the ruling and the 26 years old law prohibiting me from carrying my weapons including pepper spray on 650 million acres, 30% of the land mass of the United States of America, stands as the law of the land. Like I said, I'm lost. I don't consider this a good thing. The second admendment doesn't count on a 1/3 of the nation......

Mac-10s and other "saturday night special" weapons are for overall spraying an area with non-targeted cover fire. I have fired them as well. A judge rules inviromental laws need to be scruntinized and to retain a 26 year old law prohibiting guns. so Obama will not challenge the ruling and the 26 years old law prohibiting me from carrying my weapons including pepper spray on 650 million acres, 30% of the land mass of the United States of America, stands as the law of the land. Almost all Federal Land is "State Forests," and you are allowed to go hunting in these places. I assume that "hunting" allows you to use a gun? Hunting is not legal in parks - So I see no reason to allow people to lug around m-16's. On the other hand, I see no reason why you should be barred from carrying a pistol for self protection, and I don't mean the native "animals." Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: As much of a backer of the 2nd Amendment as I am, I really can't see why such guns as a MAC-10 should even be manufactured. The military doesn't want them. They don't work very well as self-protection weapons - So who wants or needs them? What is their real purpose? I was at a gunshow yesterday, and frankly, many of the weapons I saw for sale made me shake my head: M-2 .50 Cal Machine guns! Yes, if you have the right permit, you can buy a fully functional one. About four different varieties of .50 Cal Sniper Rifles - great for hunting rabbits and coyotes I guess. And no permit of any kind require for those babies - guaranteed to shoot 5 inch groups at 2000 yards! Super - or stupid - - I was walking through this gigantic show, which covered an area larger than a football field, with my son who is a Policeman. We just shook our heads at all the weird guns people were snatching up, and the huge lines at the Ammo Concession, where people were panic-buying hundreds of pounds of bullets . .. What was even more scary was that I saw groups speaking spanish, russian, and several other languages buying up all kinds of guns - spooky... My feeling were definitely mixed. I'm a gun owner, but I didn't buy anything. Neither did my son - though we both looked at several handguns. As we left, I kinda wondered if any of those people would some day aim one of those at my boy - chilling. . . When I dropped him off at his house, my last words were, "Make sure you always wear your vest to work..." "I always do," he said..... I agree GW...... there are a slew of weapons available that never should be... a man needs a shotgun or two, a rifle he can hunt with, a .22 for plinking and maybe a varminter for the long range challenge.. oh, and a handgun. But then there be a bunch of "Rambo's" and gangsta's running around... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: After you listen to all the arguments and all the excuses we all come back to the fact that Guns dont commit crimes, people do! We have plenty of laws on the books right now restricting gun ownership, which applies to felons and misdemeanors. Enforce the ones on the books already. The end line is that some in our government are just down right afraid of law abiding citizens having rights and the power to challenge them if the day ever comes. You take the guns away, the law abiding citizens lose that power, thus losing their rights and eventually their freedoms. Whats next after the second admendment is taken away, the first admendment. You can try and paint it another way, but the truth here is black and white, we have enemies within, they are called Socialists and Communists and they are trying to take over our nation.

content: As much of a backer of the 2nd Amendment as I am, I really can't see why such guns as a MAC-10 should even be manufactured. The military doesn't want them. They don't work very well as self-protection weapons - So who wants or needs them? What is their real purpose? I was at a gunshow yesterday, and frankly, many of the weapons I saw for sale made me shake my head: M-2 .50 Cal Machine guns! Yes, if you have the right permit, you can buy a fully functional one. About four different varieties of .50 Cal Sniper Rifles - great for hunting rabbits and coyotes I guess. And no permit of any kind require for those babies - guaranteed to shoot 5 inch groups at 2000 yards! Super - or stupid - - I was walking through this gigantic show, which covered an area larger than a football field, with my son who is a Policeman. We just shook our heads at all the weird guns people were snatching up, and the huge lines at the Ammo Concession, where people were panic-buying hundreds of pounds of bullets . .. What was even more scary was that I saw groups speaking spanish, russian, and several other languages buying up all kinds of guns - spooky... My feeling were definitely mixed. I'm a gun owner, but I didn't buy anything. Neither did my son - though we both looked at several handguns. As we left, I kinda wondered if any of those people would some day aim one of those at my boy - chilling. . . When I dropped him off at his house, my last words were, "Make sure you always wear your vest to work..." "I always do," he said..... Wandering and Wondering

A judge rules inviromental laws need to be scruntinized and to retain a 26 year old law prohibiting guns. so Obama will not challenge the ruling and the 26 years old law prohibiting me from carrying my weapons including pepper spray on 650 million acres, 30% of the land mass of the United States of America, stands as the law of the land. Like I said, I'm lost. I don't consider this a good thing. The second admendment doesn't count on a 1/3 of the nation......
reply: Almost all Federal Land is "State Forests," and you are allowed to go hunting in these places. I assume that "hunting" allows you to use a gun? Hunting is not legal in parks - So I see no reason to allow people to lug around m-16's. On the other hand, I see no reason why you should be barred from carrying a pistol for self protection, and I don't mean the native "animals." Dave
title: Another Obama Gun Control Myth Debunked

content: But....but...Obama wants my guns!!! Fox news even said so!! No matter, I'll stockpile ammo and still blow away the first police officer that dares enter my sacred abode to steal my second amendment right! OMG! Was that them right now!?!?! No, it was just a girl scout. Whew. Well, I'm still sure they're on their way!

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: As much of a backer of the 2nd Amendment as I am, I really can't see why such guns as a MAC-10 should even be manufactured. The military doesn't want them. They don't work very well as self-protection weapons - So who wants or needs them? What is their real purpose? I was at a gunshow yesterday, and frankly, many of the weapons I saw for sale made me shake my head: M-2 .50 Cal Machine guns! Yes, if you have the right permit, you can buy a fully functional one. About four different varieties of .50 Cal Sniper Rifles - great for hunting rabbits and coyotes I guess. And no permit of any kind require for those babies - guaranteed to shoot 5 inch groups at 2000 yards! Super - or stupid - - I was walking through this gigantic show, which covered an area larger than a football field, with my son who is a Policeman. We just shook our heads at all the weird guns people were snatching up, and the huge lines at the Ammo Concession, where people were panic-buying hundreds of pounds of bullets . .. What was even more scary was that I saw groups speaking spanish, russian, and several other languages buying up all kinds of guns - spooky... My feeling were definitely mixed. I'm a gun owner, but I didn't buy anything. Neither did my son - though we both looked at several handguns. As we left, I kinda wondered if any of those people would some day aim one of those at my boy - chilling. . . When I dropped him off at his house, my last words were, "Make sure you always wear your vest to work..." "I always do," he said..... I agree GW...... there are a slew of weapons available that never should be... a man needs a shotgun or two, a rifle he can hunt with, a .22 for plinking and maybe a varminter for the long range challenge.. oh, and a handgun. But then there be a bunch of "Rambo's" and gangsta's running around... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: After you listen to all the arguments and all the excuses we all come back to the fact that Guns dont commit crimes, people do! We have plenty of laws on the books right now restricting gun ownership, which applies to felons and misdemeanors. Enforce the ones on the books already. The end line is that some in our government are just down right afraid of law abiding citizens having rights and the power to challenge them if the day ever comes. You take the guns away, the law abiding citizens lose that power, thus losing their rights and eventually their freedoms. Whats next after the second admendment is taken away, the first admendment. You can try and paint it another way, but the truth here is black and white, we have enemies within, they are called Socialists and Communists and they are trying to take over our nation.
